command-def.name: grep - print lines matching a pattern

methods.method: Filters the input lines and writes the matching lines to the output. A line matches if it contains the given {@code pattern} using case-sensitive string comparison.
Filters the input lines and writes the matching lines to the output.iles contained in Whether or not a line matches the given {@code pattern} depends on the specified {@code options}.method.

options.option: Match lines ignoring the case when comparing the strings, also known from Unix with its acronym 'i'.
Invert the match result, that is, a non-matching line is written to the output and a matching line is not. This option is also known from Unix with its acronym 'v'.
Uses fixed-strings matching instead of regular expressions. This option is also known from Unix with its acronym 'f'.

operands.operand: Lines will be printed which match the given pattern
